Things change...i glimpsed at some past entries of mine...i used to be so impassioned. it's not like i'm apathetic now i guess i just grew frustrated with talking so much shit and being unable (emotionally or otherwise) to do anything. never fear though...i got goals and more importantly--perhaps--i got plans. in the past year, i've become a new entity, or at least a different version of the person i've always been. i think people still like me, the people that matter to me, anyhow. i feel guilty when i notice how i've let my stressed state and taxed emotional state affect my interactions with other people, people i love. as the target of too frequently misplaced anger, i used to think this was one of the universe's worse crimes. (i still do.) i would never allow myself to do that, not knowingly. and now...but it's a funny thing, because it hasn't caused any problems. i'm allowed to be human and fuck up and people understand and don't hold it against me--don't get it twisted i'm not abusing anyone. but sometimes i'm harsher than i would be had i paid more attention. and...it's ok. amazing. increasing self-reliance. i think i'm inclined equally towards introversion and extroversion. lately i've been reveling in my solitude while simultaneously yearning for more human interaction--with more humans. not that i don't love my friends but i think when your whole world is comprised of the same 7 people, life can get claustrophobic. still struggling. just...experiecing diffused energy cuz there are so many struggles. i think once i get my life more properly aligned, i will be able to focus energy. just gotta get past the next 2 days. keep having these conversations about what love is, what love isn't. love is something i have in abundance. love is something i'm constantly searching for. what if i'm bi-sexual? bi-amorous? that would really fucking suck. i feel like that's a pandora's box situation, like if i never go down that road, i'll be straight...literally. VERY much looking forward to going home. you have no idea. Tuesday i will be in my cap & gown, taking a walk across a stage. my name will be called. no idea when i'll get my diploma...that depends on how sympathetic 2 of my professors are. yes, it's come to this. and i can't complain because... as much as i would like to leave here with a diploma, the fact that i'm leaving at all is good enough for me.

people make plans and God laughs. i look back on the plans i once had and laughed at how nothing quite worked out that way, but everything worked out some way.  everything is want want want but actually i'm quite content.  i feel like the wanting/yearning is the manifestation of the space in between who i am and who i desire to become.  i want the distance between the 2 to be bridged by...things...i want to tesser (throwback to madeline l'engle & a wrinkle in time) to avoid having to experience the distance, but it's a distance i have to travel so..i guess i should get started.  this is my form of resisting change & growth, wanting all these things, everything.  the fact is that i'm satisfied. looks like i'll graduate and if i don't, it will be a matter of credits i can make up at any other university (most likely wayne state), so i'm not too concerned.  maybe i should be more concerned but i'm not because i lack motivation to do because in my mind i'm already done.

anywho. it's that time where i will find any & every way to try to motivate myself to keep working. usually this centers on me allowing myself to participate in some type of ongoing distraction (like snood or sleep) after completing set amounts of work. tonight/this early morning's distraction was me writing out what i want from an ideal guy/relationship.  it's really a topic i avoid, because i know that after years of fantasizing there's a lot to say.  so i never really thought about it in depth. i might focus on ONE thing but not everything.  and i see why, because so far i have almost 2 pages. single-spaced.  if i had that much focus on these papers i need to write, i would have been finished with everything weeks ago.  but i'm glad i picked this diversion for tonight/this early morning.  i'm going to save it and keep it handy for those times when i start forgetting. 

i won't say i have unresolved issues with a certain someone.  but i will say that thoughts of someone from a year ago are resurfacing, just because i want to ensure that i don't repeat the mistake. 

i'm really looking forward to going back home.  i  know i will miss school friends.  it's going to be strange knowing i won't be back in september to see "everybody".  but this epoch of my life has reached its end, and it's time to move on.  i'm sure we'll find our way back to one another (permanently, not just to visit) at some point.  until then...there will be frequent e-mails, IM's, & phonecalls and less frequent visits.

i know inherent in all of this is my perfectionism...but still i think 85-100% of the time, you attract what you project, so i'm seeing that some part of this is a personal flaw...i started realizing the problem when i was looking at my male friends and realized that i would never date guys like them, for various reasons. and i was like HMM...if i wouldn't date them...why am i friends with them? friendship requires more effort than dating...and that's why i now only have 2 close male friends... + 1 steve...because steve will just always be around *shrug*. and now, thinking of female friends as god-mothers...i'm in the same boat, thinking that i really shouldn't be interacting so closely with people whose vibes i'm just generally not feeling. so that's what has me on quasi-hermit mode, and why i've been very selective about who i share me with, which includes why i haven't been updating.

preface: i've never been in love. it's not because i'm coldhearted. it's because i'm 20, and though many fail to find the logic, i'm really a rather rational invidual. as such, i understand that i will not know what it means or how it feels. that's fine & dandy, i'm not asking about that. question (& background info): a lot of friends & acquaintances who share their business with me are in that ex-factor situation. they're no longer in a relationship with their ex. perhaps the relationship ended months ago, maybe it's been a couple years. for quite a few people this has to do with college & the long-distance thing, but for others that's just not the case. and all these people say the same thing "my ex treats me like shit". but then they say "we might get back together soon". when i ask why, they say "because i love him/her". clarification: i'm not asking how you can love someone who treats you like shit (that i actually understand quite well). but what i am asking is why do you stick around when you know the situation is not going to improve? why? hypotheses: is it because you're hoping that somehow they will decide to become a better person and start treating you better? hoping that if you stick around long enough they will see that you are "the one"? afraid that you'll never feel that same love with anyone else but the ex? do you prefer accepting shitty treatment to possibly *gasp* having to be alone for awhile, or investing yourself into a new relationship? afraid you'll never find anyone better? do people think the pain makes their lives richer & fuller somehow? reiteration of the question: i just do not understand, can someone please explain to me why people stay (in one form or another) in these horrible relationships that cause such immense pain, or remain attached to people who treat them so terribly?

a people divided... the columbia community was depressed today. when kerry came on tv to announce his concession/conceding, everybody was watching it in tears, hugging & crying...it was JUST like watching september 11th on tv 3 years and 2 months ago...deja vu like a bitch. people were taking pictures of everyone just staring in awe, teary eyed or sometimes sobbing. i was in a daze, standing there stupified with students and professors alike just fearful and depressed. last night i got back to nyc. my cab driver from the airport was listening to npr, but they were talking about the war in iraq, so i asked him if he knew anything about the election. he said no, then asked where i was from. he asked me how i thought michigan was gonna go--for kerry, or for bush. my answer was that i didn't know. before i got home i was like democratic, no question. but after i got there, i heard the proliferation of pro-bush, anti-gay marriage ad's on both wjlb AND 105.9 and was DISGUSTED. only to meet actual black bush voters in real life and wanting to WRETCH. and yesterday, i was getting pretty fucking annoyed with people who jokingly or seriously told me i should have voted for kerry, because no the fuck i shouldn't have or were mad that i voted for nader--clearly these people are confused, be mad at people who voted for bush. you know them, you see them, you interact with them every day. holla at THEIR asses. I, isis sushiela indirah smith, KNOW what the fuck is up. i KNOW bush is not about shit but fattenin his pockets & those of his homies. i know this war was based on a lie, i know all he is doing is alienating us from the global community and making as MORE likely to suffer terrorist attacks reminiscent of 9/11, i KNOW that outlawing both gay marriage and abortion are next on his plate, i KNOW he wants to privatize EVERY FUCKING THING that should be a human right, i KNOW that renquist is gettin sick and bush will have the power to replace him with a religious right zealot. i know ALL of this shit about bush, THAT is why i don't like him, and THAT IS WHY I DIDN'T VOTE FOR HIS ASS. god damn that's the fucking end of that story. forget all this electoral college shit. if the estimates are any where near being close to correct, bush won the POPULAR vote by over 3 million. 3 mutha fuckin million. be mad about THAT shit. be mad that Kerry conceded when there were still hundreds of votes to be counted, when there were allegations of double voting in some florida counties, when there were allegations of voter intimidation in both ohio & michigan, be mad that college students from all over the states & abroad, who registered months in advance for their absentee ballots didn't get them until yesterday or haven't gotten them at all. be mad that by conceding the election before all the ohio votes had been counted, Kerry basically gave out a big FUCK YOU to all the Ohio voters who waited in line to 1am and later to vote, thinking their votes actually MATTERED. DO NOT get mad at a person who just MIGHT be more well-informed on "the issues" than you are, has a basic knowledge of the political process and being fed up with the BULLSHIT that it is, has decided not to perpetuate bullshit, by voting for the candidate of his or her choice. obviously i'm angry, everyone has a right to be mad. but point that shit in the right fucking direction. Unless there really is a revolution of thought, no outside party candidate will EVER be the reason that a main party candidate doesn't win. Cuz even with all the support Nader got from those who would traditionally be considered democrats in 2000, Gore STILL won the election. Nader is not the reason that Gore was not our president in 2000, BUSH & Gore are. Bush cuz he stole the election, and Gore cuz he did nothing about it. i don't even think 3 million people voted for nader in TOTAL, so even if every single nader voter had been on the kerry side, it wouldn't have made a difference. yes i am upset about bush being our president & i have been getting stares at my home-made "buck fush" t-shirt all day. but it's the system that enabled him this much success that pisses me off even more. choosing the leader of your COUNTRY for the next 4 years should NEVER come down to choosing "the lesser of 2 evils". KERRY FUCKING LOST TO BUSH! to BUSH! HOW THE FUCK DO YOU LOSE AGAINST A FUCKING MORON? At least Gore technically won. Kerry did not, in any way. What does that say about him? Anybody But Bush was a flawed campaign from the beginning, because the mere fact that Bush is the president has proven how having "ANYBODY" in office is lethal. why don't we the people get off our asses, and instead of just electing someone cuz we think he has a good chance of beating the guy we all hate, find someone who we actually LIKE as a candidate, who we actually believe can do some good for us all, individually and collectively? politics involves the allocation and centralizing of power. when we have elected officials, we hand over to them OUR power. i think entirely too much of myself to just be giving that to ANYBODY but bush. FUCK THAT. we're all guilty, because none of us did shit in 2000, which was when all of this really mattered. this whole shit is the failure of the american people, and not just the republicans.

the simple answer of how i came to believe what i believe is this: i have always been interested in the intangible world, and just knowing things, knowing everything. i took what i was taught & what i was read, and i picked what i liked, and i discarded what i didn't like, and some things i've always believed and other things i have and will make up as i go along.

my mom & granny would probably be considered "liberal" christians. i was raised up in the salvation army http://www.salvationarmy.org--yes it is based on community service and uplifting the poor and otherwise overlooked (drug addicted, elderly, crippled) but it is first and foremost an organization dedicated to spreading the word of God. The Salvation Army is unlike any other Christian denomination that I know of, and I have a great love and respect for the Sal.

Being raised up in the sal, i was taught many things. the rules of the salvation army are that no officer (legally recognized pastor) can preach at any corps (church) for more than 5 years, to emphasize the fact that a church is God's house, not any particular preacher's. this being the case, i was exposed to a variety of differing viewpoints on exactly what Christianity is/was. However, as a confirmed member, then adherent, then solider of the Sal, the basis of my beliefs was this:

We believe that the Scriptures of the Old and New Testaments were given by inspiration of God, and that they only constitute the Divine rule of Christian faith and practice.

We believe that there is only one God, who is infinitely perfect, the Creator, Preserver, and Governor of all things, and who is the only proper object of religious worship.

We believe that there are three persons in the Godhead - the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost, undivided in essence and co-equal in power and glory.

We believe that in the person of Jesus Christ the Divine and human natures are united, so that He is truly and properly God and truly and properly man.

We believe that our first parents were created in a state of innocency, but by their disobedience, they lost their purity and happiness, and that in consequence of their fall, all men have become sinners, totally depraved, and as such are justly exposed to the wrath of God.

We believe that the Lord Jesus Christ has by His suffering and death made an atonement for the whole world so that whosoever will may be saved.

We believe that repentance toward God, faith in our Lord Jesus Christ and regeneration by the Holy Spirit are necessary to salvation.

We believe that we are justified by grace through faith in our Lord Jesus Christ and that he that believeth hath the witness in himself.

We believe that continuance in a state of salvation depends upon continued obedient faith in Christ.

We believe that it is the privilege of all believers to be wholly sanctified, and that their whole spirit and soul and body may be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

We believe in the immortality of the soul, the resurrection of the body, in the general judgement at the end of the world, in the eternal happiness of the righteous, and in the endless punishment of the wicked.

this is the dogma/doctrine of the salvation army, also called the 11 articles of war, which as a teen i had to memorize, in order to claim my rightful place in the Detroit Harding Corps as soldier from the Appling line. (My family has a history at my church).

if this seems to be veering off track, what can i say? i'm going into detail about the sal because the sal was my first introduction to what faith or God was, and was a huge part of my life from age 3-17, and also was heavily tied to my family.
